name: Longsword
description: A longsword is a versatile weapon that can be used with one or two hands. It has a straight, double-edged blade and a hilt that provides a secure grip.

name: Shortsword
description: A shortsword is a small, light, and versatile weapon that can be used with one or two hands. It is designed for quick and agile strikes in close combat.

name: Greatsword
description: A greatsword is a massive two-handed sword, often over 5 feet in length, with a straight double-edged blade. It is designed for powerful sweeping and chopping attacks.

name: Battleaxe
description: A battleaxe is a single-handed axe designed for combat. It has a sharp metal blade mounted on a sturdy wooden or metal shaft, and is capable of delivering powerful and devastating blows.

name: Greataxe
description: A greataxe is a massive two-handed battle axe with a heavy, broad blade designed for cleaving through armor and bone.

name: Mace
description: A mace is a blunt weapon with a heavy, metal head mounted on a sturdy wooden or metal shaft, designed for delivering powerful and crushing blows in close combat.

name: Spear
description: A spear is a pole weapon consisting of a shaft, usually of wood, with a pointed head. The head may be simply the sharpened end of the shaft itself, as is the case with fire-hardened spears, or it may be made of a more durable material fastened to the shaft, such as flint, obsidian, iron, steel or bronze.

name: Dagger
description: A dagger is a short, double-edged blade used for thrusting or stabbing. It is often used as a secondary weapon or for utility purposes.

name: Rapier
description: A rapier is a slender, sharply pointed sword designed for thrusting attacks, often used in fencing.

name: Scimitar
description: A scimitar is a curved, single-edged sword of Middle Eastern origin. It is designed for slashing and cutting, and is often used in a sweeping motion to inflict maximum damage.

name: Flail
description: A flail is a weapon consisting of a striking head attached to a handle by a flexible rope, strap, or chain. The striking head is typically a spiked ball, but can also be a cylinder with spikes or a metal rod with a heavy weight at the end.

name: Morningstar
description: A morningstar is a medieval weapon consisting of a spiked ball mounted on a shaft, resembling a mace, but with a longer shaft and a spiked head.

name: Halberd
description: A halberd is a two-handed pole weapon that consists of an axe blade topped with a spike mounted on a long shaft. It is designed to be used for thrusting, chopping, and hooking.

name: Club
description: A club is a simple weapon consisting of a length of wood or metal shaft with a heavy head on one end.

name: Quarterstaff
description: A quarterstaff is a long wooden pole, typically around 6 to 9 feet in length, that is used as a melee weapon. It is often made from hardwood and is designed to be both lightweight and durable.

name: Falchion
description: A falchion is a one-handed, single-edged sword of European origin, whose design is reminiscent of the Persian shamshir, the Chinese dadao, and modern machetes. It has a curved blade that widens towards the point, giving it a weight-forward balance that makes it ideal for chopping and slashing.
